if you haven't played this game, you'll never be a true gamer.
Perfect for a coop to test the durability of a friendship. Nice puzzles and great dubbing.
this game is amazing in so many ways

My favortie game of all time. It is extremely fun and is filled to the brim with charm and humor. If you haven't played this game yet what the hell is WRONG WITH YOU?!

ÐžÐ´Ð½Ð° Ð¸Ð· Ð»ÑƒÑ‡ÑˆÐ¸Ñ… Ð¸Ð³Ñ€ Ð¼Ð¸Ñ€Ð°. 10 Ñ‚ÑƒÑ€ÐµÐ»ÐµÐ¹ Ð¸Ð· 10

SOME SPOILERS MAY NOT BE PROPERLY MARKED. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

If you enjoyed "Portal", or found this game through a recommendation or otherwise, congrats! This is an incredible game, and worth the play-through!

[b]NOTE:[/b] As mentioned, there is a previous game. [i]However,[/i] it is not necessary to play it to enjoy this game. In fact, they end up covering anything important you may have missed at the beginning. I do personally recommend you play the first game, though.

[b]STORY LINE:[/b] Unlike its predecessor, "Portal 2" follows a fun and creative plot, picking up from the end of the previous game. There are a few twists, and it's well-written with sarcasm, humor, and seriousness galore.

[b]GAME PLAY:[/b] Similar to "Portal". Puzzles that slowly get harder as you get further into the game. Requires brain power. Usage of a portal device. As I said in my review for "Portal", it's not surprising you use a portal device, with a game name like "Portal 2".

[b]GAME CONTROLS:[/b] It is [i]highly recommended[/i] that if you are using a laptop or any computer with a touchpad that you use a mouse. Otherwise, your gaming experience will be very, very difficult. Arrow-keys are used for moving your character around. Spacebar to jump. Mouse used to look around and shoot portals. Other buttons are explained in game.

[b]CHARACTERS:[/b] You play as a mute character. They do not speak. Unlike the previous game, however, you interact with a much more... chatty AI, who isn't the brightest tool in shed, but has a heart of gold. [spoiler]Y'know. Until they take over.[/spoiler] Also, there is a reappearance of a character from the previous game. Character development.

[b]CO-OP:[/b] Yes! There is Co-Op! A true test of your loyalty with your friend... or possibly your sense of humor. Unlike the previous game, you can now play with a friend as two robots completing tests. It is recommended to play this after completing this game. It's not necessary, however.

[b]CAUTION:[/b] Please keep in mind that looking at these spoilers may change or ruin your experience, as they are not necessary for enjoyment of the game. They are only if you get disturbed easily by a lack of nothing, loud noises, or sudden events. If you [spoiler]die[/spoiler], you may be kind of freaked out. Also, [spoiler] it may be startling to encounter turrets, which will shoot at you[/spoiler]. You also encounter (PRETTY BIG SPOILER, I LIGHTLY DON'T RECOMMEND LOOKING) [spoiler]an abandoned facility, which may be creepy if you don't like that stuff[/spoiler]. Finally, (MAJOR SPOILER, I DO NOT RECOMMEND LOOKING) [spoiler]yet again, you're betrayed by an AI. Go-freaking-figure.[/spoiler].

"Portal 2" is an amazing game that will keep you preoccupied for a while. Whether you're enjoying the sarcastic remarks of a character, figuring out how to solve a puzzle, or just plain impressed with its good graphics, "Portal 2" is awesome for people of all ages.

I was lucky enough to go into the Portal Series completely blind and I can say it was one hell of a ride. This game is literally one of the most god tier games ever made. The 16 hours I spent playing had been some of the best 16 hours of my life so far. I wish I could play this game for the first time again. Thank you Valve for this masterpiece.
